task.title: How to change the layer blend mode
task.shortdesc: Layer blend modes change the way layers react with each other. These are like sunglasses for your layers that can become x-ray specs and a whole lot more.

context.p: You can use blending modes whenever you need to change how the colors of a whole level interact.

step.cmd: Click on the Layers icon Layers icon
Select the layer you want to apply the blend mode to.
Click on the "N" symbol on the right side of the layer.
Choose a new blend mode of choice from the drop down menu that has shown up. The default is Normal.

result.p: You have now changed the blend mode and the symbol on the right side of the layers panel will no longer be "N".

example.p: If you choose a layer mode like "Darken" for example, you will be anything that is darker than white is going to have some darkening effect on the pixels below it.
